title: Waning Moon
summary: A simplifying stretch that favors completion, editing, and gentle release over expansion.

meaning.headline: Simplify and finish—this phase favors editing and release over expansion.

frames.text: The waning Moon emphasizes wrapping up and lightening the load.
It’s a good time to edit, tidy processes, and clear what’s complete.
This forces endings or guarantees closure.

frictions: Clinging to tasks or ideas that are finished
Adding new commitments instead of closing loops
opportunities: Release what no longer needs attention

do: Close out one or two open loops.
Edit or declutter before adding more.
Rest when momentum dips instead of forcing expansion.
avoid: Holding onto work that’s ready to end
Treating slowing pace as a problem to fix immediately

reusable_lines.text: Clear space by finishing and releasing what’s complete.
Edit and simplify rather than adding more.

allowed_framing: Process-focused: “this phase helps you tidy and release.”
Agency-forward: “you can decide what to finish and what to drop.”
Non-deterministic: “a softer pace can make room to clear clutter.”
